Class KataUtils

java.lang.Object
dev.bjdelacruz.katas.utils.KataUtils
public final class KataUtils extends Object
This class contains a set of methods that will help solving future Java katas much easier.

    • makeStringsList

      @Deprecated public static List<String> makeStringsList(List<Character> letters)
      Deprecated.
      Given a list of N letters, returns a list of all possible combinations of strings with length N.
      Parameters:
      letters - Originally a list of N letters.
      Returns:
      List of strings with length N.

    • getAllPermutationsOfSubsequences

      public static List<String> getAllPermutationsOfSubsequences(Set<Character> chars)
      Given a set of N characters, generates a list of permutations of strings with length 0 to N.
      Parameters:
      chars - The set of N characters.
      Returns:
      The list of permutations of strings with length 0 to N.

    • createList

      public static List<?> createList(String line, String delim, KataEnums type)
      Creates a list of objects of a particular data type from a string (usually, a line read in from a file).
      Parameters:
      line - The string containing a specific data type.
      delim - The delimiter, e.g. a whitespace character.
      type - The data type of the objects in the list.
      Returns:
      A list of objects of a particular data type, or null if problems were encountered parsing the string.

    • readLines

      public static List<String> readLines(String filename)
      Given the name of a file, reads in all the lines from the file.
      Parameters:
      filename - Name of a file.
      Returns:
      A list containing all the lines that were read in.

    • stringsListToString

      public static String stringsListToString(List<String> strings)
      Given a list of strings, returns a concatenated string containing all the strings in the list.
      Parameters:
      strings - The list of strings.
      Returns:
      A concatenated string containing all the strings in the list, separated by spaces.

    • replace

      public static List<String> replace(String string, String oldString, String newString)
      Given a string, a substring to replace, and a replacement substring, returns a list of strings that contains one replacement substring per string. For example, replaceAllOccurences("A dog is a dog", "dog", "cat"), where "dog" is the substring to replace and "cat" is the replacement substring, returns "A cat is a dog" and "A dog is a cat".
      Parameters:
      string - The string that contains the substring to replace.
      oldString - The substring to replace.
      newString - The replacement substring.
      Returns:
      A list of strings that contains one replacement substring per string.

    • createPlayingCards

      public static List<PlayingCard> createPlayingCards(List<String> lines)
      Creates a list of playing cards from lines read in from a file.
      Parameters:
      lines - Lines containing a list of playing cards (e.g. 2C, KS).
      Returns:
      A list of playing cards.

    • getBalanceAsString

      public static String getBalanceAsString(int value)
      Given a number that represents currency, e.g. 40000, returns the same number as a string with a period inserted behind the second to last digit, e.g. 400.00.
      Parameters:
      value - The number to format, e.g. 40000.
      Returns:
      The number formatted with a period behind the second to last digit, e.g. 400.00.
